intro: Sphaeralcea patagonica, commonly known as Patagonian globemallow, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. It has hairy, glandular leaves that help reduce water loss, and its structure is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Sphaeralcea patagonica is an important species in its native habitat, contributing to local biodiversity and ecological stability.
